intro: Ardisia purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-leaf ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green to purple-colored leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are typically clustered in the leaf axils. Following flowering, it develops bright red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Ardisia purpurascens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
